posts.name: link ‚ú¶
posts.cooked:
The Signal team is releasing the Signal 7.57 beta soon. If you‚Äôre interested in participating, join the beta group here.

Share your feedback on the latest changes:

  • (please fill this in later)

Complete list of new commits since 7.56.0:

https://github.com/signalapp/Signal-Android/compare/v7.56.0‚Ä¶main

Thank you for being a beta tester!

link_counts.title: Beta feedback for the upcoming Android 7.56 release

posts.cooked:
New Version: 7.57.0 (158900)

Builds will no longer be published to Firebase App Distribution

38 new commits since 7.56.9:

Show commits

  • Always fetch remote configs on app update. [1]

  • Update to RingRTC v2.57.1 [2]

  • Add data seeding playground. [3]

  • Fix debuglog spacing. [4]

  • Add MainActivity scaffold anchoring. [5]

  • Start conversion from Fragment Nav Framework to utilizing a centralized AppSettingsRouter. [6]

  • Allow for multiple captchas to be solved during registration. [7]

  • Add prompt to re-enable local backups post restore. [8]

  • Mark decision state during instrumentation testing. [9]

  • Accept legacy call links. [10]

  • Convert NotificationsSettingsFragment to compose. [11]

  • Disable vector drawable rasterization in donations library. [12]

  • Hide some error states for unregistered users. [13]

  • Pre-seed navigation when intent is processed before navigator is set. [14]

  • Expand the detail anchor if we select a conversation while the list is maximized. [15]

  • Fix various issues in main activity display. [16]

  • Fix navigator to ensure we don't end up with a weird backstack. [17]

  • Add fixes for primary choice when returning to chats. [18]

  • Always include english translations for emoji search. [19]

    Updates the emoji_search table by including English emoji labels alongside existing localized labels, enabling users to search for emojis in both their preferred language and English.

  • Upgrade to libsignal 0.80.3 and add a new trust root for sealed sender. [20]

  • Add logging around overrides in notification profiles. [21]

  • Bring back proper archive delete reconciliation. [22]

  • Fix inconsistent default PIN keyboard type. [23]

  • Fix crash when opening the change number registration lock screen. [24]

  • Add more logging around notification profile overrides. [25]

  • Improve restore complete dialog for old device. [26]

  • Disable autofill for PIN entry fields. [27]

  • Make max envelope size remote configurable. [28]

  • Bump to libsignal v0.81.0 [29]

  • Add Billing API and Google API availability error dialogs. [30]

  • Pass all android.libsignal.* prefixed remote configs down automatically. [31]

  • Switch lookupUsernameHash to use libsignal's typed API wrapper. [32]

  • Upgrade Kotlin, AGP, Gradle versions and bring in kotlinx-serialization for use with navigation-compose. [33]

  • Fix restore error string formatting. [34]

  • Fix potential crash in story send. [35]

    Fixes #14331

  • Convert Media to kotlin. [36]

  • Update translations and other static files. [37]

  • Bump version to 7.57.0 [38]

Gathered from signalapp/Signal-Android v7.56.9‚Ä¶v7.57.0

Message with link preview stuck in processing/sending.

posts.name: ClauZ
posts.cooked:
7.57.0 Connection issues

trying to resubscribe to paid remote backup, and I get these errors.. Play store searching for apps works

Screenshots

image523√ó1036 110 KB
image523√ó1036 73.6 KB
image523√ó1036 60.8 KB

log: https://debuglogs.org/android/7.57.0/6aef894192cccf792d144d879bb7ae26dd9d555b525ef722e509952710d3e1e1

same issue on a different device / google account

I turned off and deleted back-ups .. and then tried re-enabling it

log: https://debuglogs.org/android/7.57.0/62a69bdc0176724d6e07a3179f41404e6905f0333725c01d23c222809419528d

1. Registered a new phone number
2. Enabled free remote backups
3. Create a backup
4. Clear app data
5. Restore from remote backup, using the ‚Äúlost phone‚Äù flow
6. Try to upgrade to paid tier
7. Get the same connection error as above.

So right now, I can‚Äôt upgrade to paid‚Ä¶

log: https://debuglogs.org/android/7.57.0/1ad8ca9368ca17293f3e5281ed473d080356d45ae0ef925d24631f1ad1d3c625

7.57.0 On device backups

Can we have a label next to On device backups to show the state of local backups ? enabled / disabled

Screenshots

image523√ó1036 96.6 KB

7.57.0 Reg lock state

My main phone number is still in reg lock jail
so when I try to register it, after I put in the SMS code, it asks for my PIN, after I put in the PIN, it shows a toast with the text ‚ÄúReg Lock!‚Äù, then if I back out all the way to the main screen,
The main screen looks like this..

Screenshot

image494√ó1036 82.1 KB

Should this single button main screen, still be in the app ?

log: https://debuglogs.org/android/7.57.0/a5846c5f50f64b1effbd8056a7bb0981faf98b404d67658eb80c5dd78cb16968

7.57.0 Crash on username search

Searching for a username to start a new conversation crashes Signal

log: https://debuglogs.org/android/7.57.0/2ca43c157fda007eae5d1d46733de3c3932b55c34e5f36053510d81bf598ec29

higher android version: https://debuglogs.org/android/7.57.0/e12949ec7f734c8563f0454560a808550b8a6ebd3e593f9c4be90d190ffb483c

7.57.0 Transfer account back out

If you go to Settings ‚Üí Account ‚Üí Transfer Account and then you tap Back, you get the Stop device transfer dialog

Screenshots

image494√ó1036 58.3 KB
image494√ó1036 56.8 KB

Is that where it‚Äôs supposed to show up ?

log: https://debuglogs.org/android/7.57.0/cc0fb2cf3bccb21937b9d5ad3a3b132fc037678b951d0732784043e86c06e65a

7.57.0 Crash when backing out of Paypal

I tried donating to signal with paypal, got to the paypal app, noticed I wasn‚Äôt logged in, so I tapped back, and Signal crashed.

Log: https://debuglogs.org/android/7.57.0/52ff8bb5d9fe1cc9c20bdcea22e42c7cfec53617b80bb3ba6eaf1b038c451d76

7.57.0 Crash when donating for a friend

I tried donating for a friend, with a card that had in sufficient funds, and Signal crashed‚Ä¶

Log: https://debuglogs.org/android/7.57.0/9e913407051f3eefc8b845c00a36fc70df21ba70783e96624d3a465a114eec29

7.57.0 Translation missing

So, when I wanna donate to signal via bank transfer, from my Romanian Signal, I get this chunk of untranslated text in english, that I need to ‚ÄúAgree‚Äù to, but how am I supposed to agree to something I don‚Äôt understand‚Ä¶ ?

screenshot

image718√ó1600 120 KB

log: https://debuglogs.org/android/7.57.0/3f8b67ec8ad6630956794b55da86259bc2c4044f8c4972371d8c10662f92e716

update: That string doesn‚Äôt exist in the app, so I assume it‚Äôs coming from Stripe,
and I see it only changes to RO, when I have device language set to RO, and Signal language set to System default

If device language is RO and Signal language is RO as well, that text is in english..
anyway, it most likely doesn‚Äôt have anything to do with the current beta‚Ä¶

7.57.0 Polish phone numbers

So I was trying to restore a backup with a Polish phone number, but I added a digit by mistake to the number, and Signal let me continue to the recovery key input screen, and of course the key didn‚Äôt work‚Ä¶ Then I spent a few minutes double checking the recovery key

48 453 909 061 8

My point is, maybe the phone number should be on screen while inputting the recovery key
And if 10 digit polish numbers are not valid, then the phone number input screen should not allow you to continue

posts.name: sigfun
posts.cooked: If you are in a call, and that person sends you a view-once photo, and you open it while in the call, nothing is shown. But going back to the call and out again shows it briefly and disappears almost immediately.

posts.name: Steve
posts.cooked:
Sorry I‚Äôm a bit late.

@cody-signal , you asked in

Beta feedback for the upcoming Android 7.56 release Android Beta Feedback
Great! Tracking. Since it‚Äôs not a thing on other platforms we aren‚Äôt including them at the moment. That may change in the near future, but for now, it is what it is. Good catch. Tracking. Tracking. Unfortunately, yes. Did you do anything special with this current install? Like drastically change versions or restore from a certain local backup? The initial releases were, now we are doing full betas. Yeah, it‚Äôs better but something is still wrong. Yeah, we really need to ‚Ä¶

Unfortunately, yes. Did you do anything special with this current install? Like drastically change versions or restore from a certain local backup?

To which I want to reply, No. Just regular usage. Staying withing the boundarys the app gives me. No custom build. No (recent) database backups/imports. Getting the updates from playstore. Vanilla style I guess.

I just updated to 7.57.0. Let‚Äôs see how it goes.

posts.name: Salt
posts.cooked:
Beta feedback for the upcoming Android 7.56 release

Bitwarden doesn‚Äôt support saving passwords via CredentialManager, only passkeys (but that functionality should be available soon).

@jeffrey-signal You mentioned in a previous thread that Bitwarden was implementing CredentialManager soon, but the PR you linked was actually merged back in July and part of the 2025.7.2 release: Release Password Manager 2025.7.2 (20551) ¬∑ bitwarden/android ¬∑ GitHub

So is the implementation still incomplete on Bitwarden‚Äôs end or could it be an issue with Signal? Happy to help test!

link_counts.title: Beta feedback for the upcoming Android 7.56 release

posts.name: Whatnoww
posts.cooked:
I‚Äôm being asked to renew my subscription although I am subscribed and it shows as if my plan is the paid one

https://debuglogs.org/android/7.57.1/b42929211a8509878b7ed82afc4ffe1f90d42f58febd41f2bfcd6793f6aae29b

Salt505:

@jeffrey-signal You mentioned in a previous thread that Bitwarden was implementing CredentialManager soon, but the PR you linked was actually merged back in July and part of the 2025.7.2 release: Release Password Manager 2025.7.2 (20551) ¬∑ bitwarden/android ¬∑ GitHub

So is the implementation still incomplete on Bitwarden‚Äôs end or could it be an issue with Signal? Happy to help test!

I just took a closer look at that Bitwarden PR, and it actually only adds support for retrieving existing passwords and doesn‚Äôt implement the methods needed for saving new credentials using CredentialManager

I believe bitwarden/android/pull/5579 will implement the functionality needed for this feature to work with Bitwarden. Apologies for the mix up!

link_counts.title: [PM-24148] [Draft] add credential manager provider for create passwords by Nailik ¬∑ Pull Request #5579 ¬∑ bitwarden/android ¬∑ GitHub

posts.name: Nix (N1X)

posts.name: Nix (N1X)
posts.cooked: Just fixed on 7.57.1
Ditto on the subscription to the paid tier, getting a ‚ÄúSomething Went Wrong‚Äù screen, tried on Wi-Fi and cellular, only difference is I‚Äôve never signed up for paid tier previously.
